content: As written two years ago, some languages have troubles with utf8 (clash becomes unsolvable in them). Since it doesn't add any value, nor is it a vital part of the problem, I am removing the utf8 parts.
¾ and the French letters with accents are not ASCII characters so either the problem statement shouldn't talk about "ascii code" and "ASCII representation" or the test cases should be modified.
Please avoid any utf8 char here. Not all languages can deal with them.

Validator 4 seems to be problematic.  The problem is that Validator 4 is the only one to use extended ASCII.  Which in ruby to get the right output requires me using chr('UTF-8').

I have updated "One more for the road" to include an extended ASCII char.

Cool clash ! I also think that it could be a great one in shortest mode.

Maybe you should add a test with one packet  having a length of zero to cover all egde cases. This may seem absurd to have a packet with nothing but you didn't clearly mention that this was impossible :)

Like it! I think shortest mode would be also valid for this clash.

On small thing: at first I didn't realize that p can contain multiple packages. I know it's stated, I just jumped over that somehow. Maybe if you modify it a little bit like: "The 4 first bits of *every* packet", then it would be a bit clearer. However maybe it's just me and nobody else is bothered by this :)
It says "p contains one or more packets", I think it is good enough.
j'y ai pensé mais je me suis dit que ça faisait pas beaucoup de sens de recevoir un paquet vide xD

Thanks for the report, you're right the validator 4 uses a French text with accent whereas all the other test doesn't. I didn't think about that

Also, does this mean that anyone can update any clash of code ?
Anyone with the enough clashes under their belt.  Not sure exactly how many that is.

well we're never too clear ! I did add this word for more clarification and the shortest mode.

Thank you for your feedback !
